definition: topic under discussion/thread of discussion
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)

sentences.english: As the debate drew to a close, Bush took on the question of character.
sentences.chinese: 随着辩论接近尾声，布什把话锋转向人格问题。

sentences.english: She has a mercurial turn of conversation.

definition: thread of discussion/topic
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to make a detour/to go by way of
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
to stop/to halt
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to set off/to take to the road
to answer back sarcastically (idiom)/to retort
tone of voice/topic/subject under discussion
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to speak out/to start speaking
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
